docs.title: Welcome to Knowledge Base
docs.text:
Build beautiful documentation in minutes

A modern documentation template powered by MkDocs Material

Get Started View Examples

docs.title: Lightning Fast
docs.text: Built on MkDocs with instant loading, search-as-you-type, and optimized performance.

docs.title: Beautiful Design
docs.text: Material Design with dark/light mode, custom colors, and modern typography.

docs.title: Easy to Write
docs.text: Write in Markdown with powerful extensions for code, diagrams, and more.

docs.title: Easy to Deploy
docs.text: One command to deploy to GitHub Pages, Netlify, or any static host.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Get up and running in 3 steps

Step 1: InstallStep 2: CreateStep 3: Serve 
pip install mkdocs-material

mkdocs new my-project
cd my-project

mkdocs serve

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: Command Description mkdocs serve Start live-reloading dev server mkdocs build Build static site for production mkdocs gh-deploy Deploy to GitHub Pages mkdocs new [name] Create a new project

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
knowledge-base/
├── mkdocs.yml              # Configuration file
└── docs/

    │   ├── advanced-formatting.md
    │   └── code-examples.md
    ├── api/                # API reference
    │   ├── overview.md
    │   └── endpoints.md
    ├── examples/           # Examples & recipes
    ├── faq.md              # FAQ
    └── about.md            # About page

docs.title: About My Company
docs.text: This documentation demonstrates various MkDocs features and serves as a template for your projects.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
This Knowledge Base showcases:

  • Different documentation page types
  • Markdown formatting options
  • Navigation structure patterns
  • Best practices for technical documentation

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
knowledge-base/
├── mkdocs.yml              # Main configuration
└── docs/
    ├── index.md            # Homepage
    ├── about.md            # This page
    ├── faq.md              # FAQ page
    ├── getting-started/    # Getting started section
    │   ├── installation.md
    │   ├── quickstart.md
    │   └── configuration.md
    ├── user-guide/         # User guide section
    │   ├── markdown-basics.md
    │   ├── advanced-formatting.md
    │   └── code-examples.md
    ├── api/                # API documentation
    │   ├── overview.md
    │   └── endpoints.md
    └── examples/           # Example pages
        ├── tables-lists.md
        └── images-media.md

docs.title: Page Types Demonstrated
docs.text: Page Type Example Use Case Landing Page index.md Project overview, quick links Tutorial quickstart.md Step-by-step guides Reference configuration.md Configuration options API Docs endpoints.md API reference documentation FAQ faq.md Common questions Examples code-examples.md Code samples, recipes

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
• Multi-level navigation
  • Section grouping
  • Clear hierarchy

docs.title: Markdown
docs.text:
• Headers and sections
  • Tables (basic and complex)
  • Lists (ordered, unordered, task)
  • Code blocks with syntax highlighting
  • Links (internal and external)
  • Blockquotes
  • Definition lists

docs.title: Extensions
docs.text:
• Table of Contents with permalinks
  • Fenced code blocks
  • Tables

docs.title: How to Use This Template
docs.text:
1. Clone or copy this project structure
  2. Customize mkdocs.yml with your site name and settings
  3. Replace content in the Markdown files
  4. Add your pages and update navigation
  5. Preview with mkdocs serve
  6. Deploy with mkdocs gh-deploy or your preferred method

docs.title: Quick Commands
docs.text:
# Start development server
mkdocs serve

# Build static site
mkdocs build

# Deploy to GitHub Pages
mkdocs gh-deploy

# Build with strict mode (shows warnings as errors)
mkdocs build --strict

docs.title: ReadTheDocs (Default in this project)
docs.text:
theme:
  name: readthedocs

Simple, clean, widely recognized documentation style.

docs.title: Material for MkDocs
docs.text:
theme:
  name: material

Modern, feature-rich theme with many customization options.

Install with: pip install mkdocs-material

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
• MkDocs Documentation
  • Material for MkDocs
  • Markdown Guide

docs.title: License
docs.text: This template is provided as-is for educational purposes. Feel free to use and modify for your projects.

docs.title: Version
docs.text:
Current version: 1.0.0

Last updated: February 2024

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Common questions and answers about using MkDocs.

docs.title: What is MkDocs?
docs.text: MkDocs is a fast, simple static site generator that's geared towards building project documentation. Documentation source files are written in Markdown, and configured with a single YAML configuration file.

docs.title: Why use MkDocs over other documentation tools?
docs.text:
Advantages of MkDocs:

  • Simple setup and configuration
  • Fast build times
  • Live preview server
  • Easy deployment to GitHub Pages
  • Large ecosystem of themes and plugins
  • Pure Python (easy to extend)

docs.title: What are the alternatives?
docs.text: Tool Language Best For MkDocs Python Project documentation Sphinx Python Python projects, extensive docs Jekyll Ruby Blogs, general sites Docusaurus JavaScript React-based projects GitBook JavaScript Commercial documentation Hugo Go Speed-critical sites

docs.title: How do I install MkDocs?
docs.text:
pip install mkdocs

For the Material theme:

pip install mkdocs-material

docs.title: What Python version is required?
docs.text: MkDocs requires Python 3.8 or higher.

docs.title: Can I use MkDocs without Python knowledge?
docs.text:
Yes! Basic usage only requires:

  • Editing Markdown files
  • Basic YAML configuration
  • Running a few terminal commands

docs.title: Where do I configure MkDocs?
docs.text: All configuration is in mkdocs.yml at the root of your project.

docs.title: How do I add navigation?
docs.text:
nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - About: about.md
  - User Guide:
    - Getting Started: guide/start.md
    - Advanced: guide/advanced.md

docs.title: How do I change the theme?
docs.text:
theme:
  name: material  # or 'readthedocs', etc.

docs.title: Can I use custom CSS?
docs.text:
Yes, add to mkdocs.yml:

extra_css:
  - stylesheets/custom.css

Then create docs/stylesheets/custom.css.

docs.title: What Markdown flavor does MkDocs use?
docs.text: MkDocs uses Python-Markdown with extensions. It's compatible with CommonMark with some additions.

docs.title: How do I link between pages?
docs.text:
[Link to page](other-page.md)
[Link to section](other-page.md#section-heading)

docs.title: How do I add images?
docs.text: ![Alt text](images/screenshot.png)

docs.title: Can I use HTML in Markdown?
docs.text:
Yes, HTML is supported:

<div class="custom">
  Custom HTML content
</div>

docs.title: How do I add code with syntax highlighting?
docs.text:
Use fenced code blocks with language identifier:

```python
def hello():
    print("Hello, World!")
```

docs.title: How do I build the site?
docs.text:
mkdocs build

This creates a site/ directory with static HTML files.

docs.title: How do I preview locally?
docs.text:
mkdocs serve

Then open http://127.0.0.1:8000 in your browser.

docs.title: How do I deploy to GitHub Pages?
docs.text:
mkdocs gh-deploy

This builds and pushes to the gh-pages branch automatically.

docs.title: Can I deploy elsewhere?
docs.text:
Yes! After mkdocs build, the site/ folder can be deployed to:

  • Netlify
  • Vercel
  • AWS S3
  • Any static hosting

docs.title: Build fails with "page not found"
docs.text:
Check that:

  1. Files exist in the docs/ directory
  2. File paths in nav match actual files
  3. File extensions are .md

docs.title: Live reload not working
docs.text:
Try:

  1. Clear browser cache
  2. Restart mkdocs serve
  3. Check for syntax errors in mkdocs.yml

docs.title: Theme not applying
docs.text:
Ensure:

  1. Theme is installed: pip install mkdocs-material
  2. Theme name is correct in mkdocs.yml
  3. Run mkdocs build --clean

docs.title: Broken links after deployment
docs.text:
Check:

  1. site_url is set correctly
  2. Use relative links: [link](../page.md)
  3. Case sensitivity on server

docs.title: How do I add search?
docs.text:
Search is built-in. Configure in mkdocs.yml:

plugins:
  - search:
      lang: en

docs.title: Can I use multiple languages?
docs.text:
Yes, with the i18n plugin:

pip install mkdocs-i18n

docs.title: How do I add versioning?
docs.text:
Use the mike plugin for version management:

pip install mike
mike deploy 1.0
mike deploy 2.0 latest

docs.title: Can I include external Markdown files?
docs.text:
With the include plugin:

pip install mkdocs-include-markdown-plugin

docs.title: Where can I find more documentation?
docs.text:
• Official MkDocs Docs
  • Material Theme Docs

docs.title: Where do I report bugs?
docs.text: • MkDocs GitHub Issues

docs.title: Is there a community?
docs.text:
• Stack Overflow: Tag mkdocs
  • GitHub Discussions
  • Discord servers for documentation

docs.title: API Endpoints
docs.text: Detailed documentation for all available API endpoints.

docs.title: List Users
docs.text:
Retrieve a paginated list of users.

GET /users

Parameters:

Name Type In Description page integer query Page number (default: 1) limit integer query Items per page (default: 20) status string query Filter by status: active, inactive

Example Request:

curl -X GET "https://api.example.com/v1/users?page=1&limit=10" \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY"

Example Response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "status": "active",
      "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Jane Smith",
      "email": "jane@example.com",
      "status": "active",
      "created_at": "2024-01-16T14:20:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "limit": 10,
    "total_items": 42,
    "total_pages": 5
  }
}

docs.title: Get User
docs.text:
Retrieve a single user by ID.

GET /users/{id}

Parameters:

Name Type In Description id integer path Required. User ID

Example Request:

curl -X GET "https://api.example.com/v1/users/123" \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY"

Example Response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "id": 123,
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "status": "active",
    "role": "admin",
    "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
    "updated_at": "2024-01-20T08:15:00Z"
  }
}

docs.title: Create User
docs.text:
Create a new user.

POST /users

Request Body:

Field Type Required Description name string Yes User's full name email string Yes Unique email address password string Yes Min 8 characters role string No user (default), admin

Example Request:

curl -X POST "https://api.example.com/v1/users" \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     -d '{
       "name": "New User",
       "email": "newuser@example.com",
       "password": "securepassword123",
       "role": "user"
     }'

Example Response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "id": 124,
    "name": "New User",
    "email": "newuser@example.com",
    "status": "active",
    "role": "user",
    "created_at": "2024-01-25T09:00:00Z"
  }
}

docs.title: Update User
docs.text:
Update an existing user.

PUT /users/{id}

Parameters:

Name Type In Description id integer path Required. User ID

Request Body:

Field Type Required Description name string No User's full name email string No Unique email address status string No active, inactive

Example Request:

curl -X PUT "https://api.example.com/v1/users/123" \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     -d '{
       "name": "John Updated",
       "status": "inactive"
     }'

docs.title: Delete User
docs.text:
Delete a user.

DELETE /users/{id}

Example Request:

curl -X DELETE "https://api.example.com/v1/users/123" \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY"

Response: 204 No Content

docs.title: List Products
docs.text:
GET /products

Parameters:

Name Type In Description category string query Filter by category min_price number query Minimum price max_price number query Maximum price in_stock boolean query Filter by availability

Example Response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Widget Pro",
      "description": "A professional widget",
      "price": 29.99,
      "category": "electronics",
      "in_stock": true,
      "quantity": 150
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Get Product
docs.text: GET /products/{id}

docs.title: Create Product
docs.text:
POST /products

Request Body:

{
  "name": "New Product",
  "description": "Product description",
  "price": 19.99,
  "category": "electronics",
  "quantity": 100
}

docs.title: List Orders
docs.text: GET /orders

docs.title: Get Order
docs.text: GET /orders/{id}

docs.title: Create Order
docs.text:
POST /orders

Request Body:

{
  "user_id": 123,
  "items": [
    {
      "product_id": 1,
      "quantity": 2
    },
    {
      "product_id": 5,
      "quantity": 1
    }
  ],
  "shipping_address": {
    "street": "123 Main St",
    "city": "Anytown",
    "state": "CA",
    "zip": "12345",
    "country": "US"
  }
}

docs.title: Error Codes
docs.text: Code Description INVALID_REQUEST Request body validation failed RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND Requested resource doesn't exist DUPLICATE_ENTRY Resource already exists (e.g., email) RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED Too many requests UNAUTHORIZED Invalid or missing API key FORBIDDEN Not authorized for this action INTERNAL_ERROR Server-side error

docs.title: Webhooks
docs.text:
Configure webhooks to receive real-time notifications:

POST /webhooks

Supported Events:

  • user.created
  • user.updated
  • user.deleted
  • order.created
  • order.completed
  • order.cancelled

Webhook Payload:

{
  "event": "order.created",
  "timestamp": "2024-01-25T10:00:00Z",
  "data": {
    "id": 456,
    "user_id": 123,
    "total": 59.98
  }
}

docs.title: API Overview
docs.text: This section demonstrates how to document an API using MkDocs.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The Example API provides programmatic access to our platform's features. This RESTful API uses JSON for request and response bodies.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text:
All API requests should be made to:

https://api.example.com/v1

docs.title: API Key Authentication
docs.text:
Include your API key in the request header:

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
     https://api.example.com/v1/users

docs.title: Getting an API Key
docs.text:
1. Log in to your dashboard
  2. Navigate to Settings > API Keys
  3. Click Generate New Key
  4. Copy and securely store your key

Warning: Never share your API key or commit it to version control.

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Required Description Authorization Yes Bearer token for authentication Content-Type Yes* application/json for POST/PUT Accept No application/json (default)

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text:
GET /users?page=1&limit=10&sort=created_at&order=desc
Parameter Type Default Description page integer 1 Page number limit integer 20 Items per page (max: 100) sort string id Field to sort by order string asc Sort order (asc or desc)

docs.title: Success Response
docs.text:
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "id": 123,
    "name": "Example"
  },
  "meta": {
    "request_id": "req_abc123"
  }
}

docs.title: Error Response
docs.text:
{
  "status": "error",
  "error": {
    "code": "INVALID_REQUEST",
    "message": "The request body is invalid",
    "details": [
      {
        "field": "email",
        "message": "Invalid email format"
      }
    ]
  },
  "meta": {
    "request_id": "req_xyz789"
  }
}

docs.title: HTTP Status Codes
docs.text: Code Status Description 200 OK Request succeeded 201 Created Resource created successfully 204 No Content Request succeeded, no content returned 400 Bad Request Invalid request format 401 Unauthorized Missing or invalid authentication 403 Forbidden Authenticated but not authorized 404 Not Found Resource doesn't exist 429 Too Many Requests Rate limit exceeded 500 Internal Server Error Server error

docs.title: Rate Limiting
docs.text:
API requests are limited to:

  • Free tier: 100 requests per minute
  • Pro tier: 1,000 requests per minute
  • Enterprise: Unlimited

Rate limit headers are included in every response:

X-RateLimit-Limit: 100
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 95
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1640000000

docs.title: Pagination
docs.text:
List endpoints return paginated results:

{
  "data": [...],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "limit": 20,
    "total_items": 150,
    "total_pages": 8
  }
}

docs.title: Versioning
docs.text:
The API is versioned via URL path:

https://api.example.com/v1/...
https://api.example.com/v2/...

The current stable version is v1.

docs.title: SDKs and Libraries
docs.text:
Official SDKs are available for:

  • Python SDK
  • JavaScript SDK
  • Go SDK

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• View the API Endpoints documentation
  • Try the API in our Interactive Playground

docs.title: Images and Media
docs.text: How to include images, diagrams, and media in your MkDocs documentation.

docs.title: Inline Image
docs.text: ![Alt text](path/to/image.png)

docs.title: Image with Title
docs.text: ![Alt text](path/to/image.png "Image title on hover")

docs.title: Image from URL
docs.text: ![MkDocs Logo](https://www.mkdocs.org/img/favicon.ico)

docs.title: Recommended Structure
docs.text:
docs/
├── images/
│   ├── screenshots/
│   │   ├── dashboard.png
│   │   └── settings.png
│   ├── diagrams/
│   │   ├── architecture.png
│   │   └── flow.png
│   └── logos/
│       ├── logo-dark.png
│       └── logo-light.png
├── index.md
└── guide.md

docs.title: Reference Images
docs.text:
From the same directory:

![Screenshot](./screenshot.png)

From images folder:

![Dashboard](../images/screenshots/dashboard.png)

docs.title: Fixed Width
docs.text: <img src="../images/logo.png" alt="Logo" width="200">

docs.title: Fixed Height
docs.text: <img src="../images/logo.png" alt="Logo" height="100">

docs.title: Percentage Width
docs.text: <img src="../images/banner.png" alt="Banner" style="width: 100%;">

docs.title: Max Width
docs.text: <img src="../images/photo.png" alt="Photo" style="max-width: 500px;">

docs.title: Centered Image
docs.text:
<p align="center">
  <img src="../images/centered.png" alt="Centered">
</p>

docs.title: Float Left
docs.text:
<img src="../images/icon.png" alt="Icon" align="left" style="margin-right: 10px;">
Text flows around the image on the right side.

docs.title: Float Right
docs.text:
<img src="../images/icon.png" alt="Icon" align="right" style="margin-left: 10px;">
Text flows around the image on the left side.

docs.title: Side by Side (Table)
docs.text: Screenshot 1 Screenshot 2 Dashboard view Settings panel

docs.title: Grid Layout (HTML)
docs.text:
<div style="display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; gap: 10px;">
  <img src="img1.png" width="200">
  <img src="img2.png" width="200">
  <img src="img3.png" width="200">
</div>

docs.title: Using HTML
docs.text:
<figure>
  <img src="../images/architecture.png" alt="System Architecture">
  <figcaption>Figure 1: System Architecture Overview</figcaption>
</figure>
Figure 1: Example placeholder image

docs.title: Mermaid Diagrams (with plugin)
docs.text:
If you have the mermaid plugin installed:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Start] --> B{Is it working?}
    B -->|Yes| C[Great!]
    B -->|No| D[Debug]
    D --> B
```

docs.title: YouTube Embed
docs.text:
<iframe
  width="560"
  height="315"
  src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VIDEO_ID"
  frameborder="0"
  allowfullscreen>
</iframe>

docs.title: Local Video
docs.text:
<video width="640" height="360" controls>
  <source src="../videos/demo.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

docs.title: GIFs
docs.text:
Animated GIFs work like regular images:

![Demo Animation](../images/demo.gif)

docs.title: SVG Images
docs.text:
SVG files are well-supported and scale perfectly:

![Vector Logo](../images/logo.svg)

Or inline:

<svg width="100" height="100">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" fill="#007bff"/>
</svg>

docs.title: Screenshots Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Consistent size - Use same dimensions for similar screenshots
  2. Highlight important areas - Add boxes or arrows
  3. Compress images - Use tools like ImageOptim or TinyPNG
  4. Use PNG for UI - Better quality for text and sharp edges
  5. Use JPG for photos - Smaller file size for photographic images
  6. Add borders - Helps screenshots stand out from the page

docs.title: Recommended Formats
docs.text: Format Best For Typical Use PNG Screenshots, diagrams, logos UI images with text JPG Photos, complex images Hero images, backgrounds SVG Icons, logos, diagrams Scalable graphics GIF Simple animations Short demos WebP General purpose Modern alternative to PNG/JPG

docs.title: File Size Guidelines
docs.text:
• Thumbnails: < 50 KB
  • Regular images: < 200 KB
  • Large images: < 500 KB
  • Hero images: < 1 MB

docs.text:
Basic list:

  • Item one
  • Item two
  • Item three

Nested list:

  • Frontend
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • JavaScript
    • React
    • Vue
    • Angular
  • Backend
  • Python
  • Node.js

  • Database

  • MongoDB

docs.title: Ordered Lists
docs.text:
Steps to deploy:

  1. Clone the repository
  2. Install dependencies
  3. Configure environment variables
  4. Build the application
  5. Deploy to server

Nested ordered list:

  1. Planning Phase
  2. Gather requirements
  3. Create specifications
  4. Design architecture
  5. Development Phase
  6. Set up environment
  7. Implement features
  8. Write tests
  9. Deployment Phase
  10. Stage for testing
  11. Get approval
  12. Deploy to production

docs.title: Mixed Lists
docs.text:
Project structure:

  1. Source Code
  2. src/ - Main source files
  3. lib/ - Library code

  4. tests/ - Test files

  5. Configuration

  6. config.yaml - Main config

  7. .env - Environment variables

  8. Documentation

  9. README.md
  10. docs/ folder

docs.title: Task Lists
docs.text:
Project progress:

  • Create project structure
  • Set up development environment
  • Implement core features
  • Write documentation
  • Add unit tests
  • Deploy to production

docs.title: Definition Lists
docs.text: HTTP Methods The standard methods used in RESTful APIs GET Retrieve a resource POST Create a new resource PUT Update an existing resource DELETE Remove a resource

docs.title: Requirements Matrix
docs.text: Requirement Priority Status Notes User authentication High Done Uses JWT Data export Medium In Progress - CSV format- JSON format Email notifications Low Planned Features:- Welcome email- Password reset

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text: Action Windows/Linux macOS Save Ctrl+S Cmd+S Copy Ctrl+C Cmd+C Paste Ctrl+V Cmd+V Undo Ctrl+Z Cmd+Z Find Ctrl+F Cmd+F

docs.title: Command Reference
docs.text: Command Description Example mkdocs serve Start dev server mkdocs serve -a localhost:8080 mkdocs build Build static site mkdocs build --clean mkdocs gh-deploy Deploy to GitHub mkdocs gh-deploy --force mkdocs new Create new project mkdocs new my-docs

docs.title: Version History
docs.text: Version Date Changes 2.0.0 2024-01-15 - Major redesign- New API- Breaking changes 1.5.0 2023-11-01 - Added dark mode- Performance improvements 1.4.0 2023-08-15 - New export feature- Bug fixes 1.3.0 2023-05-01 - Added search- UI updates

docs.title: Configuration Guide
docs.text: All MkDocs configuration lives in a single file: mkdocs.yml

docs.title: Basic Configuration
docs.text:
# Site information
site_name: My Documentation
site_url: https://example.com
site_description: Project documentation
site_author: Your Name

# Repository information
repo_name: username/repo
repo_url: https://github.com/username/repo

# Theme settings
theme:
  name: readthedocs

docs.title: Simple Navigation
docs.text:
nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - About: about.md
  - Contact: contact.md

docs.title: Nested Navigation
docs.text:
nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - User Guide:
    - Getting Started: guide/getting-started.md
    - Installation: guide/installation.md
    - Configuration: guide/configuration.md
  - API:
    - Overview: api/overview.md
    - Reference: api/reference.md
  - About: about.md

docs.title: Section Index Pages
docs.text:
nav:
  - User Guide:
    - guide/index.md  # Section landing page
    - Installation: guide/installation.md
    - Usage: guide/usage.md

docs.title: ReadTheDocs Theme
docs.text:
theme:
  name: readthedocs
  # Custom settings
  prev_next_buttons_location: bottom
  style_external_links: true
  collapse_navigation: true
  sticky_navigation: true

docs.title: Material Theme
docs.text:
theme:
  name: material
  palette:
    primary: indigo
    accent: indigo
  features:
    - navigation.tabs
    - navigation.sections
    - toc.integrate
    - search.suggest

docs.title: Markdown Extensions
docs.text:
markdown_extensions:
  # Table of contents with permalinks
  - toc:
      permalink: true
      toc_depth: 3

  # Tables support
  - tables

  # Fenced code blocks with syntax highlighting
  - fenced_code

  # Footnotes
  - footnotes

  # Definition lists
  - def_list

  # Abbreviations
  - abbr

docs.title: Plugins
docs.text:
plugins:
  - search:
      lang: en
  - minify:
      minify_html: true

docs.title: Extra Settings
docs.text:
extra:
  # Social links
  social:
    - icon: fontawesome/brands/github
      link: https://github.com/username
    - icon: fontawesome/brands/twitter
      link: https://twitter.com/username

  # Version
  version: 1.0.0

  # Analytics
  analytics:
    provider: google
    property: G-XXXXXXXXXX

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
You can use environment variables in your config:

site_url: !ENV [SITE_URL, 'https://example.com']

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
site_name: My Project
site_url: https://myproject.com
site_description: Complete project documentation
site_author: John Doe

repo_name: johndoe/myproject
repo_url: https://github.com/johndoe/myproject
edit_uri: edit/main/docs/

theme:
  name: readthedocs
  locale: en

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Getting Started:
    - Installation: getting-started/installation.md
    - Quick Start: getting-started/quickstart.md
  - User Guide:
    - Basics: user-guide/basics.md
    - Advanced: user-guide/advanced.md
  - API Reference: api/reference.md
  - FAQ: faq.md

markdown_extensions:
  - toc:
      permalink: true
  - tables
  - fenced_code

plugins:
  - search

extra:
  version: 1.0.0

docs.title: Configuration Validation
docs.text:
Check your configuration for errors:

mkdocs build --strict

This will fail if there are any configuration issues.

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: This page demonstrates a typical installation guide format with modern styling.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before You Begin

Ensure you have the following installed on your system:

  • Python 3.8 or higher
  • pip (Python package manager)
  • Git (optional, for version control)

Check your Python version:

python --version

docs.title: Installation Methods
docs.text:
pip (Recommended)pipx (Isolated)From Source

The simplest way to install MkDocs:

pip install mkdocs

For the Material theme:

pip install mkdocs-material

Install in an isolated environment:

pipx install mkdocs
pipx inject mkdocs mkdocs-material

Clone and install from source:

git clone https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs.git
cd mkdocs
pip install .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
mkdocs --version

Expected output:

mkdocs, version 1.5.x from /path/to/site-packages/mkdocs

Installation Complete

If you see the version number, MkDocs is installed correctly!

docs.title: Material Theme
docs.text:
The most popular MkDocs theme with modern features.

pip install mkdocs-material

Configure in mkdocs.yml:

mkdocs.yml
theme:
  name: material
  palette:
    primary: indigo
    accent: indigo
  features:
    - navigation.tabs
    - navigation.sections
    - content.code.copy

docs.title: ReadTheDocs Theme
docs.text:
The classic documentation theme:

mkdocs.yml
theme:
  name: readthedocs

docs.title: Optional Extensions
docs.text:
Enhance your documentation with these extensions:

Extension Purpose Install Command pymdown-extensions Advanced Markdown pip install pymdown-extensions mkdocs-minify-plugin Minify HTML pip install mkdocs-minify-plugin mkdocs-git-revision-date-plugin Show last updated pip install mkdocs-git-revision-date-plugin

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Command not found: mkdocs

Add Python scripts to your PATH:

Linux/macOSWindows 
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"

Add %USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python3x\Scripts to PATH

Permission denied during install

Use the --user flag:

pip install --user mkdocs
Python version error

Upgrade Python to 3.8 or higher:

Ubuntu/DebianmacOSWindows 
sudo apt update
sudo apt install python3.10

brew install python@3.10

Download from python.org

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
Need assistance?

  • Check the FAQ
  • Search GitHub Issues
  • Ask on Stack Overflow

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Create your first documentation project.

Quick Start Guide

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Learn about all configuration options.

Configuration Guide

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get your documentation site running in under 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 1: Create a New Project
docs.text:
mkdocs new my-project
cd my-project

This creates the following structure:

my-project/
├── mkdocs.yml
└── docs/
    └── index.md

docs.title: Step 2: Start the Development Server
docs.text:
mkdocs serve

Open your browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

Tip: The server auto-reloads when you save changes!

docs.title: Step 3: Edit Your Content
docs.text:
Open docs/index.md and make changes:

# Welcome to My Project

This is my awesome documentation!

## Features

- Easy to write
- Beautiful output
- Fast builds

docs.title: Step 4: Add More Pages
docs.text:
Create new .md files in the docs/ folder:

touch docs/about.md
touch docs/tutorial.md

docs.title: Step 5: Configure Navigation
docs.text:
Edit mkdocs.yml to define your navigation:

site_name: My Project
nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - About: about.md
  - Tutorial: tutorial.md

docs.title: Step 6: Build for Production
docs.text:
mkdocs build

This creates a site/ folder with static HTML files ready for deployment.

docs.title: Step 7: Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text:
mkdocs gh-deploy

Your site is now live at https://username.github.io/my-project/

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Step Command Description 1 mkdocs new my-project Create project 2 mkdocs serve Start dev server 3 Edit .md files Add content 4 mkdocs build Build static site 5 mkdocs gh-deploy Deploy to GitHub

docs.title: What's Next?
docs.text:
• Learn about Configuration options
  • Explore Markdown Basics
  • Check out Code Examples

docs.title: Advanced Formatting
docs.text: Beyond basic Markdown, MkDocs supports advanced formatting features.

docs.title: Basic Table
docs.text:
| Header 1 | Header 2 | Header 3 |
|----------|----------|----------|
| Cell 1   | Cell 2   | Cell 3   |
| Cell 4   | Cell 5   | Cell 6   |
Header 1 Header 2 Header 3 Cell 1 Cell 2 Cell 3 Cell 4 Cell 5 Cell 6

docs.title: Column Alignment
docs.text:
| Left | Center | Right |
|:-----|:------:|------:|
| L    | C      | R     |
| 1    | 2      | 3     |
Left Center Right L C R 1 2 3

docs.title: Complex Table
docs.text: Feature Free Pro Enterprise Basic Support Yes Yes Yes Advanced Features No Yes Yes Priority Support No No Yes Price $0 $10/mo $50/mo

docs.title: Definition Lists
docs.text:
Term 1
:   Definition for term 1

Term 2
:   Definition for term 2
:   Another definition for term 2
Term 1 Definition for term 1 Term 2 Definition for term 2 Another definition for term 2

docs.title: Footnotes
docs.text:
Here is a sentence with a footnote[^1].

[^1]: This is the footnote content.

Here is a sentence with a footnote1.

docs.title: Abbreviations
docs.text:
The HTML specification is maintained by the W3C.

*[HTML]: Hyper Text Markup Language
*[W3C]: World Wide Web Consortium

The HTML specification is maintained by the W3C.

docs.title: Keyboard Keys
docs.text:
Show keyboard shortcuts:

Press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>C</kbd> to copy.
Press <kbd>Cmd</kbd> + <kbd>V</kbd> to paste.

Press Ctrl + C to copy. Press Cmd + V to paste.

docs.title: Subscript and Superscript
docs.text:
H<sub>2</sub>O is water.
E = mc<sup>2</sup>

H2O is water. E = mc2

docs.title: Highlighting
docs.text:
==This text is highlighted==

Or using HTML:

This text is highlighted

docs.title: Collapsible Sections
docs.text:
<details>
<summary>Click to expand</summary>

This content is hidden by default.

- Item 1
- Item 2
- Item 3

</details>
Click to expand This content is hidden by default. - Item 1 - Item 2 - Item 3

docs.title: Admonitions (with extensions)
docs.text:
If using Material theme or pymdownx extensions:

!!! note
    This is a note admonition.

!!! warning
    This is a warning.

!!! tip
    This is a helpful tip.

!!! danger
    This is dangerous!

docs.title: Custom Containers
docs.text:
Using HTML divs for custom styling:

<div class="warning">
  <strong>Warning:</strong> Be careful with this operation.
</div>

docs.title: Emoji (with extension)
docs.text: :smile: :rocket: :thumbsup:

docs.title: Math Equations (with extension)
docs.text:
Inline: $E = mc^2$

Block:

$$
\frac{n!}{k!(n-k)!} = \binom{n}{k}
$$

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use semantic markup - Choose elements that convey meaning
  2. Keep tables simple - Complex data might need a different format
  3. Test rendering - Preview your docs frequently
  4. Be consistent - Use the same patterns throughout

docs.title: Required Extensions
docs.text:
Add these to mkdocs.yml for full support:

markdown_extensions:
  - tables
  - footnotes
  - def_list
  - abbr
  - attr_list
  - pymdownx.mark
  - pymdownx.details
  - pymdownx.emoji
  - pymdownx.arithmatex

  1. This is the footnote content. ↩

docs.title: Code Examples
docs.text: MkDocs provides excellent support for displaying code with syntax highlighting.

docs.title: Inline Code
docs.text:
Use backticks for inline code:

Use the `print()` function to output text.
The `config.yml` file contains settings.

Use the print() function to output text. The config.yml file contains settings.

docs.title: Basic Code Block
docs.text:
Use triple backticks:

```
This is a code block
No syntax highlighting
```

docs.title: Syntax Highlighting
docs.text:
Specify the language after the opening backticks:

```python
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")
```

def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")

docs.title: Python
docs.text:
class Calculator:
    """A simple calculator class."""

    def add(self, a: int, b: int) -> int:
        """Add two numbers."""
        return a + b

    def subtract(self, a: int, b: int) -> int:
        """Subtract b from a."""
        return a - b

# Usage
calc = Calculator()
result = calc.add(5, 3)
print(f"Result: {result}")

docs.title: JavaScript
docs.text:
// ES6 Class Example
class UserService {
  constructor(apiUrl) {
    this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
  }

  async getUser(id) {
    const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/users/${id}`);
    return response.json();
  }

  async createUser(userData) {
    const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/users`, {
      method: 'POST',
      headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
      body: JSON.stringify(userData)
    });
    return response.json();
  }
}

// Usage
const service = new UserService('https://api.example.com');
const user = await service.getUser(123);

docs.title: TypeScript
docs.text:
interface User {
  id: number;
  name: string;
  email: string;
  role: 'admin' | 'user' | 'guest';
}

function greetUser(user: User): string {
  return `Hello, ${user.name}!`;
}

const user: User = {
  id: 1,
  name: 'John Doe',
  email: 'john@example.com',
  role: 'admin'
};

console.log(greetUser(user));

docs.title: Bash / Shell
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash

# Variables
PROJECT_NAME="my-project"
BUILD_DIR="./dist"

# Function to build project
build_project() {
    echo "Building $PROJECT_NAME..."
    mkdir -p $BUILD_DIR
    npm run build
    echo "Build complete!"
}

# Main execution
if [ -d "$BUILD_DIR" ]; then
    rm -rf $BUILD_DIR
fi

build_project

docs.title: SQL
docs.text:
-- Create users table
CREATE TABLE users (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Insert sample data
INSERT INTO users (username, email) VALUES
    ('john_doe', 'john@example.com'),
    ('jane_smith', 'jane@example.com');

-- Query with JOIN
SELECT
    u.username,
    COUNT(o.id) as order_count
FROM users u
LEFT JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id
GROUP BY u.username
ORDER BY order_count DESC;

docs.title: YAML
docs.text:
# Docker Compose configuration
version: '3.8'

services:
  web:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "8000:8000"
    environment:
      - DEBUG=true
      - DATABASE_URL=postgres://db:5432/mydb
    depends_on:
      - db
    volumes:
      - .:/app

  db:
    image: postgres:13
    environment:
      POSTGRES_DB: mydb
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: secret
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data

volumes:
  postgres_data:

docs.title: JSON
docs.text:
{
  "name": "my-project",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A sample project",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "node index.js",
    "test": "jest",
    "build": "webpack --mode production"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "express": "^4.18.0",
    "lodash": "^4.17.21"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "jest": "^29.0.0"
  }
}

docs.title: HTML
docs.text:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>My Page</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
    <header>
        <nav>
            <a href="/">Home</a>
            <a href="/about">About</a>
        </nav>
    </header>
    <main>
        <h1>Welcome</h1>
        <p>This is a sample page.</p>
    </main>
    <script src="app.js"></script>
</body>
</html>

docs.title: CSS
docs.text:
/* Modern CSS with variables */
:root {
  --primary-color: #007bff;
  --secondary-color: #6c757d;
  --font-family: 'Segoe UI', sans-serif;
}

.container {
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 1rem;
}

.button {
  background-color: var(--primary-color);
  color: white;
  padding: 0.75rem 1.5rem;
  border: none;
  border-radius: 4px;
  cursor: pointer;
  transition: background-color 0.3s ease;
}

.button:hover {
  background-color: darken(var(--primary-color), 10%);
}

docs.title: Code with Line Numbers
docs.text:
Some themes support line numbers:

```python linenums="1"
def fibonacci(n):
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)
```

docs.title: Highlighting Specific Lines
docs.text:
With some extensions, highlight specific lines:

```python hl_lines="2 3"
def example():
    # This line is highlighted
    # This one too
    return True
```

docs.title: Supported Languages
docs.text:
MkDocs supports many languages including:

Category Languages Web HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript Backend Python, Java, C#, Go, Rust, PHP Data SQL, JSON, YAML, XML Shell Bash, PowerShell, Zsh Config TOML, INI, Dockerfile Other Markdown, LaTeX, Diff

docs.title: Markdown Basics
docs.text: MkDocs uses standard Markdown syntax. Here's a comprehensive guide.

docs.title: Basic Formatting
docs.text:
**Bold text**
*Italic text*
***Bold and italic***
~~Strikethrough~~
`Inline code`

Renders as:

Bold text Italic text Bold and italic Strikethrough Inline code

docs.title: Headings
docs.text:
# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3
#### Heading 4
##### Heading 5
###### Heading 6

Use headings to create a clear document structure. The Table of Contents is automatically generated from headings.

docs.title: Internal Links
docs.text:
[Link to another page](../faq.md)
[Link to a section](#headings)
[Link with title](../about.md "About Page")

docs.title: External Links
docs.text:
[External Link](https://example.com)
[Link opens in new tab](https://example.com){target=_blank}

docs.title: Reference Links
docs.text:
[MkDocs][mkdocs-link] is a great tool.

[mkdocs-link]: https://www.mkdocs.org

docs.title: Unordered Lists
docs.text:
- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Nested item 2.1
  - Nested item 2.2
- Item 3
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
  • Nested item 2.1
  • Nested item 2.2
  • Item 3

docs.title: Ordered Lists
docs.text:
1. First item
2. Second item
   1. Nested item 2.1
   2. Nested item 2.2
3. Third item
  1. First item
  2. Second item
  3. Nested item 2.1
  4. Nested item 2.2
  5. Third item

docs.title: Task Lists
docs.text:
- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Incomplete task
- [ ] Another task
  • Completed task
  • Incomplete task
  • Another task

docs.title: Blockquotes
docs.text:
> This is a blockquote.
> It can span multiple lines.
>
> > Nested blockquotes are also possible.

This is a blockquote. It can span multiple lines.

Nested blockquotes are also possible.

docs.title: Horizontal Rules
docs.text: ---

docs.title: Paragraphs
docs.text:
Separate paragraphs with a blank line:

This is the first paragraph.

This is the second paragraph.

For a line break without a new paragraph, end the line with two spaces or use <br>.

docs.title: Escaping Characters
docs.text:
Use backslash to escape special characters:

\*Not italic\*
\# Not a heading
\[Not a link\]

*Not italic* # Not a heading [Not a link]

docs.title: HTML in Markdown
docs.text:
You can use HTML when Markdown isn't enough:

<div style="text-align: center">
  <strong>Centered bold text</strong>
</div>

docs.title: Summary Table
docs.text: Element Syntax Bold **text** Italic *text* Code `code` Link [text](url) Image ![alt](url) Heading # Heading List - item Quote > quote

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Learn Advanced Formatting
  • See Code Examples
